title: Candidate notified before final round interview that the salary will be $1,000 less per month than originally stated: 'There has been a slight change in the job description'
description: One expects transparency from both parties during the job application process. If job candidates are expected to be open about their expectations and expertise, then employers and hiring managers need to uphold their end of the bargain. Most of the time, candidates can figure out which companies and opportunities reflect their basic needs based on the level of transparency of the initial job posting and description. However, even then, candidates might not be getting the full picture. Keep scrolling below for this tale of an employee's unfortunate experience just before his final round interview at a new company.
author: Ben Weiss
excerpt: Candidate notified before final round interview that the salary will be $1,000 less per month than originally stated: 'There has been a slight change in the job description' - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.
text: Imagine applying for a job that meets your salary expectations and then undergoing multiple rounds of interviews only to find out that the hiring managers have decided to amend that salary range to be more than $1000 less per month. That's a significant difference and a shady move to a job candidate who has taken hours of time over the past several weeks to prepare for these meetings.  Several members in the comments section shared their feelings of frustration with the job candidate and chimed in with their own stories about salary transparency and shady behavior from recruiters and employers during the hiring process.
